news_header: Former President Alejandro Toledo of Peru has been sentenced to over 20 years in prison for corruption and money laundering related to bribery from a Brazilian construction company.
news_text: A Peruvian court has sentenced ex-President Alejandro Toledo to 20 years and six months in prison for corruption and money laundering, linked to $35 million in bribes from the Brazilian company Odebrecht. Toledo, who served from 2001 to 2006, was arrested in California five years ago and extradited to Peru last year. Judge Inés Rojas criticized Toledo for betraying public trust, while Toledo has denied the charges and reacted dismissively during the proceedings. The Odebrecht scandal has implicated several former Peruvian presidents, including Alan García, who died by suicide amid similar allegations.
